data.title: Going Downhill
data.text: The location needs some improvement. Smells musty, service is slow and food quality is not the same as in the past.

data.title: Intimate dining
data.text: Good value, especially if you use the Entertainment Book coupon! Lots of choices for side dishes, including soup or salad, potato, rice, Macaroni & cheese, veggies.

data.title: Good food!!
data.text: My friend and I ate here after I flew over from Las Vegas to spend some time with him. I had a coupon for a free lobster tail for two people that we had with our filets. Nice salad accompanied with the dinner and hot bread. Service was very good and we really enjoyed our dinner! Would highly recommend going there to eat.

data.title: Who doesn't like the Black Angus?
data.text: The food is excellent.  Best cheese garlic bread in town.  We live about a mile away and we get their potato soup to go about once a month.  We eat in the restaurant every so often and it's always good!

data.title: Gluten free beware
data.text: They screw up a lot. The last and final time we were there I asked for their burger without the bun. It took a while finally came out I took a couple bites and there was a weird texture so turned the patty over and there was bread stuck to it! Even though I explained I am gluten intolerant and waitress assured me she understood. Spent a miserably night of stomach craps and acid reflux. My husband was so upset he walked out and said he was not paying. This was the third time they screwed up that bad so we don't go there anymore. Go to outback across the street, they are way better about GF and even have GF dessert.

data.title: Good Steakhouse
data.text: I ate in the bar area it had nice large tables and plenty of large screen tv's to watch. As it was early for dinner we were about the only people there, but it had filled by the time we left. The service was fast they had are drinks and bread on the table within 5 minutes of walking in. My steak was cooked to perfection. The fries were good as well light and crunchy. My only complaint was the caramelized onions I ordered with my steak were not "caramelized" enough. There is no problem with parking here at all, plenty of spaces available in the mall parking lot. I would eat here again.

data.title: A very nice place to have a meal
data.text: The food was good, clean restaurant, clean bathrooms, slightly noisy compared to other restaurant's in the area.  The service personnel were helpful and the overall experience was good.

owner_response.author: Britt B, Guest Relations Manager at Black Angus Steakhouse - Lakewood, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Barbara,

Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent visit to our Lakewood location. We always appreciate hearing from our guests as your feedback allows us to provide the best possible experience when dining at Black Angus.

We look forward to serving you soon!

Britt B. - Guest Relations Manager, Black Angus Steakhosue
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Bad service :(  food mediocre
data.text: We came in for happy hour at about 5:00 pm. We had to wait about 10 minutes for a server. She came and took our order. We waited about 20 minutes for 2 appetizers. After the food was served, nobody came to check on us. Nobody refilled our ice tea. We couldn't get the server's attention to bring us our check. I finally had to use my cell phone to call the front desk to ask for someone to bring us our check. Pssssscht. Really? Sorry, we won't be back.

data.title: Service ruined the event
data.text:
We arrived at 4:45 on a week night. No one greeted us at the 
door and pretty soon there were four families waiting to be seated. There were employees sitting at a table in the bar talking to the bartender and still we waited for someone to acknowledge us. Someone finally came to greet us and asked our name and said it would be 10 minutes to be seated. You could've shot a canon through the restaurant and not hit anyone at a table because all we saw were empty tables. Finally seated and 
waited more than 10 minutes for a server to appear and take a drink order and then we ordered an appetizer and it was one hour that we were sitting at our table and our entrées still were not served. 
Food was very good -ribs were tender and prime rib was good.  one person had chicken and all of the sides were very good but the service was so poor we will not be back.

data.title: Pushed out because restaurant wanted to close
data.text: Food not particularly good - tough prime rib. Slow night so staff really wanted to go home - asked halfway through meal if we wanted dessert as kitchen wanted to close.  Check arrived before we'd finished eating. We felt we were an inconvenience to the staff.

data.title: Good steak
data.text: On 10/25/15 Sunday we have lunch the food was excellent, we love the food. Service was excellent her name was Crystal, but the problem is bar area was busy we did not see some one helping Crystal she was making drink, plus serving guest. We see employee was standing talking to their co worker.

data.title: Tasted like we were eating on a cruise!
data.text: This was undoubtedly one of the best meals we have ever had!  We have been here before and always loved their steaks.  This time we used a coupon for the steak, lobster and shrimp dish.  My steak was cooked to perfection and the lobster had the best seasoning ever!  The shrimp was deep fried and tasty.  The potato soup was outstanding!  Everything was so good that we felt like we had been served one of the elegant meals we have enjoyed on our previous cruises.  Do not miss this dish!!

data.title: Great happy hour specials during NFL games!
data.text: We stopped in to watch the game and try the appetizers. The potato skins and the grilled artichokes were my favorites. Great prices on all the appetizers during the game, and select discount beer as well!

data.title: Service Needs Improvement
data.text:
Not sure why we had to wait 20 minutes when there were ample open tables.  The food was tasty but slow in being served.  We used two sets of coupons at our table, which was wonderful.

We received complimentary bread with oats on top; it was warm and tasty. 

Our server did her best but never brought a napkin I requested.  She was friendly and patient but sometimes  missing; I believe she was trying her best.  The cost of the meal was of good value and everything we received was fresh and tasted good.  

I would return again in the future.

data.title: Steak!
data.text: Get a steak you will enjoy at suggestion of medium rare to medium well cooking consistency. The meat won't be too over done. The meat will be juicy and the fat will melt in your mouth. For the quality of the meats the price is decent.

data.title: Disappointing Lobster Special
data.text: My wife and I used a coupon to get a 5 oz. lobster tail for free with the purchase of one of the different steaks on the menu.  My wife had the 6 oz. Filet for $23.50 with a baked potato and grilled asparagus (for $1 extra).  I had the 12 oz. New York steak for $23.98 with house salad and sweet potato fries.  My wife and I thought the sides were good, but the steaks were just OK.  What was disappointing was the 5 oz. lobster tail.  It was mushy instead of firm and very bland in taste.  Service was very good.  No waiting to be seated on a Thursday night.  Plenty of parking.

data.title: A steak you can enjoy
data.text: I love the taste of the steak here. My favorite is the rack of Lamb but its only seasonal in summer. But there other steak is also awesome you won't regret it.

data.title: Black Angus is worth the visit
data.text:
We were down after visiting a friend with terminal cancer so I took my wife out to the Black Angus, a steak house.  She had slaved all day in the kitchen making a great dinner for her sick friend and her family.  The waiter could tell we were a bit down, so after sharing our tale of woe, he jumped right in there with the best service and conversation I have had in many years.  The filet minion was tender, tasty, and grown on the company's own ranch.  I had briefly met the founder of this chain in the 1980s in his Denver restaurant and Stuart Anderson was quite a character, cowboy hat and all.  

This restaurant went one step further for us at a rough time and even offered an unsolicited discount to us as a military discount.

Quite an experience both for our tongues and stomachs plus friendly approach.

Jim

data.title: it's not just for steak!!!!!
data.text: My husband and I have decided fish tastes better out than cooking it at home and we now go to Black Angus, not for meat but for the delicious salmon!!  The Lakewood location makes it just the way we like...juicy and crispy!!!!!  A different location put a sauce on it without us asking and we didn't like that but Lakewood leaves it simple. I like tarter sauce (and they make a good one) but my husband just uses lemon. I'm like a creature of habit because I always have broccoli with shaved parmesan cheese as one of my sides. I'm on a gluten free diet but my mouth waters just from smelling the bread and sometimes I take a tiny piece with the oats on top!!!! (I take food enzymes that are supposed to block gluten even for that tiny taste!)  We've been going for lunch lately as it feels like just the right amount of food without getting overfull . My husband orders the delicious Blackberry ginger ale sometimes and I always look forward to a sip or 2 of that!!!!!  We seem to always get coupons in the mail so for a wonderful lunch under $10, it can't be beat!!!! Once in a while when we use the coupon for dinner and get an appetizer to share we love the grilled artichoke but if we want something much less fattening we love the shrimp catalog. I know most people go there for the meat but if you're a salmon lover (and even if you're not) there's will win you over!!!!!

data.title: Decent Place To Go
data.text:
Maybe 3.5.  We live in the area and me and my husband went for lunch because we were hungry, it was close, and we had a coupon.  We've been before, a long time ago.
     The interior is somewhat dark.  We were seated by the TVs, and they changed the channel to a sports channel I wanted to watch.
     Both of us got the same thing:  steak plus your choice of 2 other things:  either chicken, shrimp, or ribs.   I got 2 servings of shrimp, and my husband got chicken and shrimp.  Plus we each got 2 side orders.  All for $15.99 with the coupon.
     The food was ok.  The steak and shrimp could have used a little more seasoning. My grilled corn on the cob, green beans, and the bread were very good.  I came away full and satisfied, and our bill was $40.  Wait service was good.
